description: Advice for pregnant women and customers using buggies on public transport

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["If you are a mum-to-be, or if you travel in London with a pushchair, we want to make public transport easy for you to use. Here are a few resources to make your journeys with us easier."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Guide to travelling while pregnant or with a buggy","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/travelling-while-pregnant-or-with-a-buggy.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 4.48MB","image":{}},{"title":"Toilet facilities map","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/toilets-map.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 352KB","image":{}},{"title":"Avoiding stairs Tube guide","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/avoiding-stairs-tube-guide.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 466KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

We want you to feel comfortable feeding your child on public transport, whether you're breastfeeding and/or bottle feeding. If you need a seat to do so, please ask if one isn't available. There are benches across the TfL network where you can feed your child too.

It is illegal for anyone to ask a breastfeeding woman to stop breastfeeding, or to leave a public place. If you are made to feel uncomfortable or experience a problem while travelling on our services speak to a member of TfL staff or use a help point.
Find out more about feeding on the move .
